file_content.text: You can't just leave me! The Republic promised!
Watch the face!
Don't take too long. My leg is cramping!
I can't believe you wouldn't let me keep my Arkanian-diamond goggles. Those were made for field missions!
This servant's outfit clashes with my eyes.
You're here! I thought you'd abandoned me!
Those incompetent soldiers you left me with are all dead! I suggested a short-cut past Imperial barracks. And they had the gall to blame me!
Me! When they went and got themselves killed, leaving me undefended!
You really think they died just to inconvenience you?
The soldiers are dead?
Well, they certainly didn't fight like they understood the stakes! I'm a wanted man!
Your precious Nebula shipment is down that way. I'll, ah, wait here while you do whatever you're doing with it.
I don't want you getting me killed, too.
Well, stay back.
Fine with me. I'm certainly not keen to be dragged into another messy fight.
Put it in your report. Right now, just tell me where the shipment is.
Just get me to the ship.
It should be down that way. That's what my assistant's notes say.
And while you go to it, I feel I best serve our mutual purpose if I just, ah, keep hiding.
This has been harrowing enough already. I mean, I've ordered plenty of deaths, but I've never had to watch!
Are there passcodes, or do I just break down the door?
First tell me how to get in.
Just lie low and wait for me.
You should be safe here.
Of course. I believe this should be the passcode to get in: 86932-11.
If all Imperial Moffs are like you, it's a wonder you can get your armor on in the morning, much less conquer an empire.
Good riddance.
My commanding officer used to say I was "unique in all his years of command...."
Oh right, the passcodes. It's, uh, 86932-11.
And before you go, do you think you can bring me some water? I'm parched. Maybe a blaster, just in case?
If this goes well, I'll be back in a minute. If not, we're both dead anyway.
You'll be fine.
Don't say that! I hate death. Especially mine.
I'm leaving.
What about some music or vids? It looks really dull in there....
If you bring the Imperial guards down on us, I'm feeding you to them.
Shut up.
You won't be leaving me any snacks, then?
I'm not saying a word.
Now, make this impertinent vixen stop asking questions and get on with my extraction!
Now, make this peon stop asking questions and do as he's told!
Oh no.
Your "reliable" source here decided to lie to save his own skin.
He lied about the shipment.
Did you think I'd let them kill me over a few lousy mansions on Herdessa?
This guy says the Republic promised him shelter if he got caught as a spy?
Does the Republic want him?
I have beachfront property already purchased.
I don't take orders from you either.
Don't even think about it.
He's still our only chance of stopping the Imperials--if he can actually help you get the Nebula prototypes in time.
Why do I get the feeling I'm not gonna like this?
He's right, Captain. I've seen the specs on Project Nebula--bad news.
He is a fool.
Rogun always said there's only two ways to deal with exclusive sources: win them or skin them.
The deal was for you to get us the Nebula shipment, Tyrak.
You go with the captain and get those prototypes to Palliser Station, or all bets are off.
How about it, Moffy? Where's the payload?
Fine. Let's go.
What exactly are you suggesting?
Go with me?
Let him point me to the blasted shipment, and someone else can escort his highness home.
I don't need him.
You need to work together. He can guide you and provide the security codes to divert the shipment.
I was fleeing for my life! Did you really expect me to--fine. I'll check my datapad. My assistant handled that sort of thing.
Um... munitions delivery A-16... fleet escort. That's the one. It leaves from the Balmorran Arms Factory ship depot. Today.
You got anything useful in there, like security specs?
What else do you know?
Today! Let's move!
Does your little pad have an inventory list? Maybe a value in credits?
How much is it worth?
If you're looking for a market, I know resistance families with old money.
According to the communiques we've tapped, the Nebula shipment is going on droid-piloted tugs.
So if you can launch them before that "fleet escort" shows up, you should be able to reprogram the droid pilots to fly anywhere.
I guess we're about to be traveling buddies.
Let's go.
This is so humiliating.
What do you say I ditch Goldie and you and me take this thing for a joyride?
[Flirt] Anywhere?
Tempting. But I'm not keen on Imperial prison.
Now that we've got the location, I don't need Goldie here.
I'll go myself.
Whatever you think of him, he's got inside knowledge we can't replicate.
What kind of force have they got guarding this thing?
What's the opposition?
It's the Balmorran Arms Factory--half the Imperial military is stationed there. I'd go in low and slow.
And we'd better stick Tyrak in disguise, probably as a servant.
A servant!
Suck it up, princess.
Ooh. I love disguises!
Let him learn humility.
You'd be surprised what you can get away with when nobody thinks you're important.
Then you can all meet up at the Arms Factory and show the Imperials what this Resistance is made of.
Are you the Republic agent? I must be extracted at once!
I am Moff Tyrak. My cover is blown. I require an armed escort to Republic territory and an immediate flight off-planet.
I believe you said there was a valuable munitions shipment stored here...?
I'm here for the shipment.
Well, I couldn't risk the Republic abandoning me, could I?
What did you do?
Your cover is blown?
Nothing!
I don't like being jerked around.
I'm not helping you.
How was I supposed to know Imperial Intelligence would start asking where I got my custom landspeeders?
That's my private property!
"Questionable spending practices," they said! "Unsustainable on my current salary," they said!
You couldn't resist splashing around the cash the Republic gave you.
So it's your own fault.
What would be the point of taking money I don't spend?
This is the problem with relying on people's greed and stupidity. It works.
He's got a point, Captain.
You deserve this.
You know, if you're looking to hide your source of income, I could hook you up with... too late, right?
If you're not a double agent, why would the Republic want you?
What use are you now?
Do you know where I can get the payload or not?
What about the shipment?
The Republic promised if I ever got caught, they'd extract me and I would retire on the Gold Beaches of Corellia. With full immunity!
I'm not saying anything!
It's best if you take two different routes out of there. Once you get out, call Tyrak on this number.
Bring him to our outpost. I'll have a unit of soldiers take him the rest of the way.
I'll have you know this is a million-credit hair color job performed by the top surgeon on Grizmallt!
I had to have all my dress uniforms hand-dyed to match.
Isn't there something better you could spend your money on?
Was it worth it?
I almost went with metallic gold, but I decided it was ostentatious.
The more you talk, the more I realize why we're at war....
Imperials are strange.
Huh?
Just shut up!
I don't want to hear it.
Fine. But it's the Republic's money that you're wasting....
I had a meal there once with Grand Moff Kilran... we went through four bottles in two hours.
Spent our unit's entire medical budget for the next month!
Next time I go drinking, it's on your tab.
Awesome!
Oh, sweet graces, no! Who thought it was a good idea letting you two spend time together?
Back on the farm, we only drank fermented bantha cud.
Ha!
Hmm. What would be the odds of talking our way into an Imperial cantina?
Come to think of it, I did most of the drinking. Kilran dragged me home after I threw up on the dancing girls....
You idiot! Every man in that place has orders to kill us!
That's an Imperial base!
Oh, yeah....
Would anyone miss you if I just left you to rot?
Shut up!
There's no need to be insulting.
I just need to know so I can remember which way we're supposed to turn.
The munitions, right?
How did you ever become a Moff?
You're an idiot.
My family has held high positions in the Imperial military for generations. Both my father and mother were proud scions of the Tyrak lineage!
Both your father and mother? So they were...?
Your mother and father were related?
Both?
I'm not really good at biology, but doesn't that make them....
They were first cousins, twice removed. Or was it once removed? It's kind of confusing because my grandfather married his niece....
The important thing is the bloodline is unbroken!
Please don't accidentally help me steal the world's largest payload of butler droids.
Yes, the munitions.
Just checking. My assistant usually keeps track of this sort of thing.
If you say one more word, I swear I will hit you.
Shut up!
I thought you Republic people were supposed to be the nice ones....
That's just sloppy. They're supposed to have a one-hundred percent kill rate.
Kind of a good thing for us since otherwise we'd be dead....
I'm glad they don't.
Oh, yeah, I guess you're right.
How much longer are we doing this?
Are we there yet?
Let me check my datapad.
I've never actually been to the Balmorran Arms Factory, but my assistant's notes say it should be somewhere over there....
If anything brings them down on us, it'll be your jabbering!
[Slap him.] Quiet!
Ow! That's going to leave a mark!
I had that cheek specially shaved by a Lethan Twi'lek slave girl descended from the royalty of two destroyed worlds!
She's built for speed. One engine at the base, one on the rear fin. Real beauty. No one in the world like her.
We will stop and pick up Betty before we leave, right?
Who's Betty?
Betty?
I don't know what you're talking about, but assume my answer is "no."
No.
Betty's my custom JG-1 landspeeder. I named her after Darth Betton, this really gorgeous--
I never take a trip without her.
Not one more word. I mean it.
[Punch him.] Shut up!
I can't believe not one patrol has raised the alert about us. I should have a word with their commander.
We should be there soon.
Which shipment is it again? Munitions or the protocol droid shipment?
I'm walking. I'm walking.
Ooh! Let's stop there for lunch. They have excellent Corellian brandy.
This would be a lot faster if I had my Betty.
Don't shoot--I'm with Numen. My squad is securing this location. We'll babysit the Moff so you can move freely.
Let's take different routes to the Arms Factory. Traveling separately will attract less attention.
We'll move out now, Captain. See you at the rendezvous coordinates....
